#Text=Laon
#Text=Laon is a city in the Aisne département of Hauts-de-France , in northern France .
#Text=Get in
#Text=There are regular train services from Paris , leaving from Gare du Nord .
#Text=As of July 2012 , prices from Paris to Laon average about € 23 one way ( second class ) .
#Text=The way to Laon from Paris is covered in 1½ hours .
#Text=There are also regular trains from Reims , or Amiens .
#Text=The train station in Laon is in the new town , at the foot of the medieval city which is on top of a hill .
#Text=With a car , you have an interchange ( number 13 ) on the A26 motorway ( from Calais to Reims )
#Text=Get around
#Text=Walking from the new town to the medieval part of the city is certainly doable , but only if you 're fit and do n't have heavy luggage with you — the 300 ft climb is a steep one .
#Text=The line N of the local bus service goes from the railway station to the medieval city every 20 minutes from Monday to Saturday .
#Text=If you 're bringing a car with you , you should probably park it in the new town , as there is very little parking available in the medieval Haute Ville .
#Text=See
#Text=The fine early Gothic Cathédrale Notre-Dame de Laon is one of the finest in France , with openwork towers and a four-storey nave elevation .
#Text=Its architecture influenced many other medieval European cathedrals , including that of Notre Dame in Paris .
#Text=The interior is extremely light and spacious .
#Text=The west towers feature an octagonal top storey with square turrets at the angles on top of the square bottom storey .
#Text=They are decorated with the figures of 16 oxen , said to commemorate a miraculous ox that appeared to pull a cartload of stone to the hilltop site .
#Text=Nearby stand the Hotel Dieu ( medieval hospital and almshouse ) , the cathedral chapter , and the town 's museum .

#Text=The museum in particular has a fine collection of classical antiquities , and the striking ' transi ' tomb ( showing the effigy of a decaying corpse ) of 14th-century clergyman and royal physician Guillaume de Harcigny .
#Text=Templar Chapel .
#Text=In the museum 's grounds .
#Text=A fine 12th-century octagonal , newly renovated .
#Text=chapel

#Text=At the other end of the medieval town , the remains of the abbey of Saint-Martin-de-Laon include its church and some of its associated buildings , including the cloister garden ( now the city library 's courtyard ) and some of the chapter house .

#Text=It 's worthwhile taking a walk around the old town , admiring the houses — almost all built between the 12th and the late 18th centuries — and the spectacular view from the town walls out across the Picard plain or hills .
#Text=Do
#Text=Climb the cathedral tower .
#Text=The tourist office ( very warm welcome ) , in a twelfth century building next to the cathedral , arranges tours , and it is best to reserve your tickets before time as numbers are limited .
#Text=Visit the underground ( see in tourist office )
#Text=Walk in the medieval city , marvellous .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Pave de Laon sweet pastilles .
#Text=A famous local cheese : Le Maroilles .
#Text=Strong and tasty .
#Text=If you buy one , provide a cooler
#Text=Eat
#Text=Les Arcades ( place du Général Leclerc ) is centrally located and good for people watching , but over-priced and the food is n't great .
#Text=The service was also pretty indifferent .
#Text=Brasserie Le Parvis 's ( 3 Place du Parvis Gaultier de Mortagne ) main selling point is its location — sitting outside , you can have your meal while looking up at the cathedral .
#Text=The service is better here but still a little distracted .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Brasserie Le Parvis ( outdoor )
#Text=Also close to the cathedral in a pedestrian plaza called " Marché aux herbes " :
#Text=Créperie Agora ( outdoor )
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Hotel-Restaurant de la Banniere de France is just behind the Hotel de Ville in the historic centre of the city .
#Text=Old and cosy hotel , appreciated by English travellers
#Text=The Hotel des Chevaliers , on the rue des Seruriers just beside the Hotel de Ville ( town hall ) is good for the budget traveller .
#Text=The upstairs rooms have been tastefully renovated ; the rooms on the first floor are in a little bit of a 1970s time warp but all are comfortable and spotlessly clean .
#Text=The owner is very friendly , lots of good suggestions for places to go .
#Text=A cosy B&B : La Maison des 3 Rois Chambres d'hôtes , 17 rue St Martin , near the historic centre
#Text=Modern hotels also , but not in historic city : Campanile , Ibis , Ibis Budget , Hotel Saint Vincent , Première classe , Fasthotel .
#Text=You need a car .
#Text=Camping « La Chênaie » , Allée de la Chênaie , 02000 Laon , ☏ +33323233863 , ✉ contact.camping.laon@gmail.com .
#Text=Wi-Fi/Internet from all area
#Text=€ 5 for 3 hr .
#Text=€ 13.40 for 1 person , tent , bike , no electricity. .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Little beautiful villages , around south of Laon : Bruyeres , Nouvion le Vineux , Presles , Urcel ( old churches ) , or Bourgignon ( village of the LeNain brothers , both painters )
